fields.description:
At the moment, the following are the condition to complete sprint:
# Have the right permission.
# All sub-task belong to completed issues in that sprints are complete.

It would be great to have the ability to set our own condition on completing sprint. The options for the implementation could be one of the following:
* The *complete sprint* button should be disabled as long as the conditions have not been fulfilled yet.
* Or an error message should be popped up when completing the sprint showing the conditions need to be fulfilled.
fields.summary: Allow Admin to set conditions on completing sprint

fields.description:
Currently the subtasks are ordered by Rank (I believe) in the view details and by subtask order when viewing the ticket fully.  

I haven't raised this as a bug, because I'm not sure what the correct order should be.

It is the issue view - so one could argue that it should look the same as viewing an issue in JIRA.  But we are in agile - so perhaps the rank order is more important.

If the rank order IS the correct way to go, there needs to be a way to rank the subtask from the planning mode.
fields.summary: Subtask ordering in details panel doesn't match the subtask order on view issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If the user has mistakenly or forgot to fill out a few fields, like the correct sprint for some tickets and the story points. The agile report will still stay as it is the original way.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can reset or re-generate the report with the latest changes applied
fields.summary: re-generate/reset report

fields.description:
When we try to see reports for finished sprints we see...

No issues present in sprint to generate scope change model

In all finished sprints. Active sprint is correct
fields.summary: No tasks in all Jira reports

fields.description:
I'd like a way to exclude stories and only include sub-tasks for the column constraint in the Agile plugin.

For my use-case, I don't care how many stories are in-progress. For my team, sub-tasks are the only measure of "unit of work" and the story is complete when all sub-tasks are delivered. I'm looking for an option like "Issue Count, excluding parent issues" on the column constraint, which would function as the inverse of "Issue Count, excluding sub-tasks".
fields.summary: Add column constraint for "Issue Count, excluding parent issues"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When board column "Done" status is changed to another column, all sprints reports, including reports for closed sprints, are modified.

The Burndown chart will show that no issues were closed within the sprint because the "Done" column is now different from the "Done" column when the sprint was active. The status in the "Done" column previously is now in a "In Progress" column, so reports show that no issue was Resolved during the sprint and thus, showing no estimates completed.

*Scenario:* A team decides to add a new step after the status that used to be the "Done" column (completion status) on previous sprints. 

*Suggestion*
JIRA Agile could save the Column settings when the sprint is closed to draw a Report accurate to the time the Sprint was Closed.
 
h3. Workaround:
Rename statuses. Instead of adding a step after the last status, change the name of the status to the new "Done" status and recreate the modified status.
fields.summary: Board column changes affects closed sprint reports

fields.description:
Even when the Epic is closed it still showing on the painel what request to click in Mark as Done to remove it.
It should be gone at the first time closed.
fields.summary: Marking an Epic as "Done" Does Not Remove it from Epic board

fields.description:
*Precondition*
# JIRA and JIRA Agile Installed.
# Agile Kanban board exists with lots of issues (1500+)

*Steps to reproduce*
# Open Kanban board with lots of issues in Firefox, e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN

(!) *Result*
* Page is greyed out
* Warning: Unresponsive script is shown

(/) *Expected Result*
* Waiting spinner is shown
* Page loads without any warnings

*My system configuration*
I run Firefox on:
* Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-3770 CPU @ 3.40GHz
* 16 GB ram

*Environment*
JIRA version: v6.5-m05#65001
JIRA Agile v6.7.4

*Additional info*
Please refer to the attached screenshots and profiling information from Chrome (file *SourceTreeRenderingCPU-20150804T115510.cpuprofile*).
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Kanban board shows a "Unresponsive script" warning in Firefox

fields.description:
At the moment, JIRA Agile cannot retrieve the service desk information to be displayed in Issue Detail View. 
For example:
The SLA information (Time to Resolution) 

This information can only be displayed in Card Layout at the moment. 

It will be great to have this ability (retrieving Service Desk information to be displayed in Issue Detail View).
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Agile to retrieve Service Desk information to be displayed in Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Drag-and-Drop feature on Agile Boards is only available if the board is filtered by Rank
If the board is filtered to something other than Rank, the drag-and-drop functionality does not work
In addition, it is no longer possible to move issues to sprints either through drag-and-drop nor by Right Click > Move to Sprint

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Drag-and-Drop and Right Click > Move to 'Sprint X' for boards sorted or ranked by another custom field
 
h3. Workaround 
Edit Board Filter so that it is only ordered by Rank:
{{ORDER BY Rank ASC}}
fields.summary: Allow Drag-and-Drop on Boards Not Filtered by Rank

fields.description:
Buenas tardes , 
Solicito por favor me hagan saber de donde podría obtener el código fuente del aplicativo , lo solicito para personalizar un poco los campos de la aplicación.
Ejemplo : Cambiar el nombre de épica por historia de usuario.

Gracias.
fields.summary: Descargar código libre

fields.description:
Dear Jira Team,
We are unable to use the Kanban board. Initiall we had about 1000 issues to release.
However, we had timeout error.
We try to lessen the number by changing query, but even with just two issues - it is not working.
Kindly let us know if we are doing something wrong.
Thank you.
fields.summary: Kanban board release feature is giving 'Time Out' error for 2 issues

fields.description:
In the agile wallboard gadget for the home screen there seems to be no quick link to the actual board itself. Links to the individual issues are good, but not enough.

If the user checks the 'show board name' in the gadget config, the board name is located in a sensible spot. It would be great if this board name could also be a quick link to the agile board itself to save the pain of navigating through the agile menu for a board you're already looking at.

On another note, it would be great if the cards on the board could be interacted with in the gadget. This would save a great deal of effort and allow a user to bring multiple boards to one screen without having to traverse their projects.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget Quick Link to Board

fields.description:
It would be interesting to know the required conditions and what's the real purpose of the new button that appears in a JIRA Agile board when the swimlanes are decided based on the Stories in the project.

As of now, the button seems to appear whenever sub-tasks of the story are not in the same column as the story, so this button should be used to move the story to the same column, however, it still appears even when the story and its sub-tasks are under the same column in some cases.
!New_feature.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the documentation regarding JIRA Agile new feature.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA Agile, when creating an issue for a project different than the current one, you get a message saying {{Your issue XX-XX has been created but is not currently visible}} and it doesn't give you a reason why it's not showing. This issue gets excluded from the current board and doesn't appear in the backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be useful to have a tool similar to the _Permissions Helper_, so we can insert the name of the issue and know why the filter is excluding from the current board.
 
h3. Workaround 
There are two possible workarounds:
- Go to the actual Project where you created the issue and look for it in the backlog. In some cases you'll need to clear the filters for it to apply.
- Modify the board's filter as per [Configuring filters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Filters].
fields.summary: Board helper to understand why issues are not visible

fields.description:
When I create a story from within an Epic (using the + next to "Issues in Epic), the story creation pop-up appears and works normally. When I save the story, the link to the Epic gets 'lost' and the story is no longer associated to any Epic. I have to find the story and 're-link' it to the intended Epic. 

I was unable to find a version that matches what we have installed, so I selected 2.5.0  - but here is the info for our instance:  
JIRA v6.4.4
Copyright © 2002 - 2015 Atlassian Corporation Pty Ltd.
The use of this product is subject to the terms of the Atlassian End User Agreement, unless other specified therein.
This product includes software developed by the Apache Software Foundation.
This product also includes the following libraries which are covered by the GNU LGPL license:
atlassian-image-consumer (com.atlassian.image:atlassian-image-consumer:jar:1.0.1)

image4j (org.jclarion:image4j:jar:0.7)
JCaptcha (com.octo.captcha:jcaptcha-api:jar:2.0-alpha-1)
JCaptcha (com.octo.captcha:jcaptcha:jar:2.0-alpha-1)
jcommon (jfree:jcommon:jar:1.0.8)
jfreechart (jfree:jfreechart:jar:1.0.13)
JSCalendar (1.0)
jStyleParser (net.sf.cssbox:jstyleparser:jar:1.16-atlassian-1)
Streaming API for XML (javax.xml.stream:stax-api:jar:1.0-2)
xapool (xapool:xapool:jar:1.3.1)
fields.summary: Story created in Epic 'loses' epic link

fields.description: We would like more than 9 color choices or the ability to choose colors similar to the color picker for card colors.
fields.summary: Add more Epic Colors

fields.description:
*When closing a sprint, any unfinished tasks are moved to 'the top of backlog' according to the dialog*, but in fact they end up in the first not-started sprint. Since we have multiple teams working on overlapping projects, we regularly have sprints from team A showing on the board of team B. When this happens, any unfinished tasks from team A may end up in a not-started sprint from team B.

It would be very nice if instead of automatically putting the unfinished tasks in some sprint, we could choose where to put them (possibly including the actual backlog). This doesn't have to be per issue, I just want to specify where the whole lot goes...
fields.summary: Allow choosing where to put unfinished issues

fields.description:
As a agile user I want to click on an JIRA issue on an agile board to see the full issue in a javascript frame without having to reload the whole page. I really want to see the whole issue in this frame as if I would reopen it in a new browser tab but without having to load the whole page.

In addition I want to have an option to disable the current sidebar issue detail view on boards.

(i) Trello for example has implemented it that way.
fields.summary: Option to show Issue detail view as a bigger central panel instead of side panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When changing configuration related to the calendars at *JIRA Administration > System*, some changes doesn't take place within JIRA Agile. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Change calendar configuration format as per [Customizing the Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+the+Look+and+Feel], in the section Date/Time format:
# Go to *JIRA Administration > System > Look and Feel*
# Set Date/Time format to 24 hours yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm  
# Check the box at the bottom to make Monday first day of the week, as per [How to set Monday as First Day of Week|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/How+to+Set+Monday+as+First+Day+of+Week+in+Date+Picker+Calendar]
# Go to *JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration > Advanced Settings* and enter the format (_sysadmin_ only):
- jira.date.time.picker.java.format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
- jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format: %Y-%m-%d %H:%M

h3. Expected Results
Calendars will be showing Monday as first day of the week, and time will be displayed in 24 hours format

h3. Actual Results
Calendars within JIRA Agile are still showing Sunday as first day of the week and am/pm format (see screenshots). The way date is displayed will change, but time seems to have no effect. In JIRA all changes have taken place correctly.

h3.Workaround
There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Changing calendar settings doesn't affect calendars within JIRA Agile

fields.description: Our team frequently used the Kanban agile boards and find it's difficult to track our work since we can't see subtasks on the board. Please make it possible to display the subtask within the Kanban board view.
fields.summary: Display Subtasks on Kanban Board

fields.description:
The name of the board switches to enter and leave the default name "Kanban board"

Environment

JIRA v6.4.6
JIRA Agile 6.7.7
fields.summary: The name of the board switches to enter and leave the default name "Kanban board"

fields.description: As a project manager I want to be able to define column constraints using the story points field (or perhaps using any number based field / custom field). In its current version the Issue Count constraint is too restrictive. The min and max should be defined as a sum of the selected field.
fields.summary: Column Constraints based on numeric fields - Agile Boards

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have and Scrum Agile Board
# Open it on Safari 8.0.7 

*Expected Results:*
- Columns should display on the top of the board.

*Actual Results:*
- Columns are showing up in the text.
!Screen Shot 2015-07-20 at 9.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround:*
- If possible, use another browser like Chrome or Firefox.

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v6.5-OD-08-001
JIRA Agile v6.7.7-D20150701T035938
Safari Version 8.0.7 (10600.7.12)
fields.summary: Column Headings on Boards are Positioned Over Cards

fields.description: On the plan view make all the mandatory field optional except maybe the key so as users of the system we can have what we want on the issue line. In addition why not all the length of each field display changeable?
fields.summary: The additional fields allowed on the Plan view to all be on one line.

fields.description:
If I'm looking at an epic, one of the things I often want to do is look at all the issues in the epic in the issue navigator and then filter on them.  

For example, today I wanted to check that none of the issues in my epic are in the "Needs Triage" state, that stops them being on the rapid board we use.  I spent way too long trying to figure out how to do this without going to the issue navigator and then using JQL.  

I think an appropriate place for this would be the little dropdown that you get for Sub-Tasks.  I know that epics don't currently have that dropdown, but obviously they should.  An issue with a collection of issues in it should probably list the issues the same way by default.  I can't immediately think why the sub-task list should contain "Show All" and "Show Open" menu options but the "Issues in Epic list shouldn't".  My guess is just different developers.
fields.summary: Epic issue view should provide a way to view issues in the issue navigator
Move issues to sprint REST API call does not seem to be working

fields.description:
The Y axis of the CFD report (JIRA Agile) should display a range that +(vertically) magnifies the data for the specific timeframe shown+.

*Current behavior:*
The scale of the Y axis (issue count) starts from 0, regardless of the timeframe being shown.
The effect is that long-running CFDs tend to look flat when one inspects a relatively short portion of the time (i.e. one week, for an initiative that has been running since several months or years). This doesn't help to appreciate bottlenecks, trends and other KPIs that such report is supposed to provide.

*Expected behavior*
The scale of the Y axis is offset to the number of issues that were in the "lower-layer" status at the start of the timeframe considered (i.e. ~450 in the attachment)
The benefit is that data are readable, regardless of the timeframe selected: trends can be better appreciated because the Y axis "zooms" to just the relevant range
fields.summary: Y axis of Cumulative Flow Diagram report should scale automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12297].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When an issue that's in a backlog gets moved from one project to another the sprint will come with it. That causes a lot of confusion if sprints are not being tracked across projects as the sprint will exist on both boards and changing one will change the other. In addition it's not possible to start the sprint unless you have administrator access across both boards and projects.

h3. Suggested Solution

It's a tricky one to solve - but perhaps making the sprint field visible on the move issue process will make end users more likely to remove the sprint value.
 
h3. Workaround 

Manually remove the sprint value yourself.
fields.summary: Moving an issue that belongs to a sprint across projects shouldn't move the sprint with it

fields.description:
Original summary: Display each sprint's board name and/or ID in the sprint field's drop-down option

h3.Problem
I'm refering to the problem mentioned here:
* [Cannot end sprint because I am not the administrator for other projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Cannot+end+sprint+because+I+am+not+the+administrator+for+other+projects]

Person A is administrator of ABC project/ board but does not have access to XYZ
Person B is administrator of XYZ project/ board but does not have access to ABC
Person C is a developer who works in both ABC and XYZ

ABC has a sprint called "Sprint 1" (id = 1)
XYZ has a sprint called "Sprint 1" (id = 2)

As C is working for both projects, when picking the sprint from sprint custom field, C accidentially sets sprint of XYZ-1 to "Sprint 1" (id = 1).
A wants to complete his sprint but unable to do so because of the problem described in the KB article linked above.

{panel}
we have hundreds of projects and thousands of users working across multiple projects in our JIRA system. Project administrators don't like to be bothered about going through workarounds each time when this happens.
{panel}

h3.Suggestion
To minimize accidental usage of the wrong sprint, would it be possible to indicate the sprint ID and the board name of that sprint in each of the drop-down options list when changing the sprint? (Screenshoht: [^sprint.png])
This is a cosmetic change but it will help JIRA users to distinguish the correct sprint.

--
Thanks!
Shaakunthala
fields.summary: Improve the information about a sprint in the sprint picker on View Issue page

fields.description: Yesterday sometimes get broken and bar with swimlane titles is displayed wrong. I've attached a screenshot. This is very annoying because I can't see first row of tickets in kanban board.
fields.summary: Bar with swimlane titles is displayed wrong on Safari 8.0.6

fields.description: As a dashboard user i want to be able to group stories by Epic Name and Epic Key in X or Y axis.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Gadget: Support of group by Epics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a user I would like to have the assignee field on the create epic screen without clicking on the configure fields option.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Click create epic
# The assignee field is already visible

h3. Workaround 
Click the configure fields option, check "assignee"
fields.summary: As a user, I would like assignee to appear on the create epic screen without configuring the screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when you have an issue in Project A, and you assign a sprint to it in Project B, then different boards will both show the same sprint.

This is a problem because changes being made in one of the projects will reflect on the other project as well. (closing sprint for example).
Nowhere in JIRA Agile are we warned that adding this issue will make the sprint overlap projects.


h3. Suggested Solution

Make this information visible through a warning message within JIRA Agile.
The idea is to make it clear for the user which Sprint from the dropdown in coming from which Rapid board. Perhaps add board-Sprint relation in the dropdown to prevent users from selecting the wrong Sprint by mistake.
fields.summary: As a user I want to get a warning when I enter a Sprint Name that already exists in a different project.

fields.description: Currently unmapped statuses on boards do not create any warning and effect the filters used on boards.  Unfortunately if you do not know there is a status that is unmapped, you cannot know that your filters will not work.  This effects burndowns and provides inaccurate views. As a feature, I would like to see a warning banner for an "invalid board" if there are unmapped statuses.
fields.summary: Unmapped statuses on boards should create an error condition

fields.description: "The burndown chart and sprint report both use the same graph and reporting process. The chart will include any issue that was given a value for its estimation field. It is possible to change the issue type to something that does not have the estimation field associated with it. At this point, those issues should stop counting toward the burndown."
fields.summary: Sprint burndown chart behaviour for issues changed to a non-estimatable type

fields.description: The Control Chart is not currently available as a dashboard gadget. As a user I would like to see this report on my dashboard.
fields.summary: Make Control Chart report a dashboard gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If custom multi-line text fields are added to the side bar, they appear inline with the field name.  
This causes all the text to be condensed and less readable. 
Please see the attached screenshots.

h3. Suggested Solution
Move the text box under the text field to make it look much neater and more readable.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like custom multi-line text fields to appear under the fieldname in the JIRA Agile detail view

fields.description:
From the issue page if you click "view on board" the UI changes to display a darkened version of the page and a spinner suggesting that a modal is about to be displayed. After a few seconds the browser is redirected to a new page. 

The veil and the modal suggest a change that never occurs.
fields.summary: Clicking the View on Board link from an issue causes a veil to be thrown up when the user should just be redirected

fields.description:
I'm using the "Agile Sprint Health", and "Agile Sprint Burndown" widgets on my dashboard

All are set to Sprint = "Next Sprint Due (auto)".
Auto refresh is ticked on "Agile Sprint Health"
Refresh interval is set to every 15 minutes

But the "Agile Sprint Health" widget isn't changing sprint automatically when one ends and another starts - I need to edit the dashboard in System > System Dashboard and re-save the gadget.

The "Agile Sprint Burndown" gadget is behaving as expected - the dashboard showed the new active sprint without requiring interaction from me.

Attached screenshot of my config for reference.

Cloned from a similar issue (GHS-11955) which was set to be fixed in Agile 6.7.6 but we are on 6.7.7 and still unresolved.

Cheers
fields.summary: "Agile Sprint Health" gadgets doesn't auto-switch sprints (but "Agile Sprint Burndown" gadget does)

fields.description:
Currently JIRA Agile uses the estimate at the time when the issue was added to the sprint, or when the sprint began (if the issue was in sprint before it started).

As a Scrum Master, I would like for JIRA Agile to use the estimates on issues at the time I start the sprint, not the estimates present as of the date/time I select as the sprint start date.

----

Example:
* Sprint created, not yet started
* Issues with estimates are added to sprint
* During sprint kickoff, estimate on a issue in sprint is changed
* Sprint is started with a start date/time selected by the user. Time chosen is prior to the estimate change on the issue
** Time selected might be start of day, start of business day, or perhaps the start of the kickoff meeting
* JIRA Agile reports on the estimate that existed on the sprint start date instead of using the estimate that is present on the issue when the sprint is started
fields.summary: Use estimates present on issues at time sprint is started, regardless of user selected sprint start date/time

fields.description:
As you can see on attached image (velocity chart report for sprint 3), issue LVES-221 is in "REVIEW" state and removed from sprint. But actually, it was done and tested within that sprint.

report: !report.png!

issue: !issue.png!
fields.summary: Velocity chart uses outdated data

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a recent update, icons associated with stories and epics, for example, are showing as broken

h3. Environment
JIRA + JIRA Agile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View *Issue Types* {{~/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa}}, and any icons that are broken will show the name of the issue type twice, (e.g. Story *Story*).

h3. Expected Results
The icons should be loading for each issue type from this page

h3. Actual Results
In my example, the missing story icon is located at {{~/download/resources/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-webactions/images/ico_story.png}}

h3.Workaround
# From *Issue Types* page, Click *Edit* under Operations for the issue type with the missing icon
# Choose an Icon from the following page, and save.
fields.summary: Story and Epic icons are broken

fields.description: I have a jira issue (story) in which I linked an epic to. I go to update the epic value to another epic or I try to clear it. It allows me to save the updated value but it's not reflected after the save. It still references the old epic in the epic field.
fields.summary: Changing Epic value on an issue is not being updated

fields.description:
By Default the navigation Bar is collapsed, This causes confusion as on agile boards especially as the Board Name and bread crumbs are only viewable in expanded view, causing additional steps to know your current working location.

h2.Request:
Set an option to set expand or collapsed View as the default option for administrators to configure.
fields.summary: Expand Project Centric Navigation By Default

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to configure or adjust the scope change requirement. Therefore any modification after the sprint has started, it consider as scope change.
h3. Suggested Solution
It should have some configuration or settings to define the scope change requirement.

h3. Example of customer requirement/scenario:
{quote}
As described below we follow a development model which is based on Agile with a few modifications.
we follow a 22 day sprint, where the first day is used for Walkthroughs and the second day for Sprint Planning and only on that day would our Managers upload the plan on JIRA and start the sprint.

The Problem we are facing is that since the Original Start date of the sprint is Day1 and we do the planning and start the sprint on Day 2 mentioning the sprint start date as Day 1 all the requirements added to the sprint on day two are considered as scope change.
JIRA here is considering the Date we specify as Sprint Start date to check for Scope changes  and it is not considering the system time when a sprint is actually started on JIRA for the same. 

our opinion is that JIRA should not consider all the requirements added to JIRA prior to Sprint Start on JIRA as scope change and should consider only issues that are added post the Sprint Start event on JIRA as scope change.
{quote}
fields.summary: scope change configuration

fields.description:
We are using OnDemand.

* Editing of the "Epic link" field is not possible anymore.
* Using the plus sign at the top of the "Issues in epic" creates a ticket outside the epic.

Others are experiencing the same change:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/18809498/epic-link-field-became-disabled
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/18450067/unable-to-choose-epic-link-on-issues
fields.summary: Regression: Cannot edit "Epic link"

fields.description: As a JIRA Administrators, I'd like to be able to set the timeout for the rapid boards. Sometimes users are in remote locations where it's excepted that the load times will be very high.
fields.summary: Configure Time Out threshold

fields.description:
As a user I want to see directly on which board I am. Therefore please change the headline "Kanban Board" to the Name of the Board.

Cheers
fields.summary: Board Name on top of Board instead of "Kanban board"

fields.description:
Add "share" function in detail view of an issue in kanban and scrumboards.

This would be a neat feature for users that never go into native Jira to handle their business.
fields.summary: Add "share" function in detail view of an issue in kanban and scrumboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12252].
  {panel}

When I browse to the Agile Start page I get this...


An error occurredHide…
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: a.hasAttribute is not a function
Resource: http://centa001-vm001:8080/s/59dc22e0043fd10c7428f1694a2b5e9e-CDN/en_US-rutl20/64022/6/911d7233246dccccc89914f774b6f844/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid-welcome,atl.general,jira.global,greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,jira.general/batch.js?jag=true&jag_disabled_marketing=true&isAdmin=true&locale=en-US
Line: 3131

fields.summary: Error on Agile Start Page

fields.description:
(on) As a user I don't want to see the "none" for custom fields on the card which do not have a value.

(!) This would fit to the overall JIRA philosophy of not showing empty values like it is configured i.e. on the view issue details screen.
fields.summary: Hide custom fields on cards if empty

fields.description:
With JIRA Agile 6.7.7 a board that covers multiple Projects will have the Active Sprints under a Dropdown menu in the Sprint View.

Previously this was displayed as a list of Sprints and could be clicked without going through the dropdown.

!list view.png!

An option to have this displayed in the previous way would allow a customer to toggle between both views.
fields.summary: Allow option to display Active Sprints in list rather than dropdown menu for Board that contains multiple Projects

fields.description: I have many projects, and one project may have two and more scrum board. When I open one board, the title of Backlog just show "Backlog", I don't know which board I selected. I have to expand left sidebar to see. Is there any way to add board name in the title of Backlog view (not just show "Backlog"), and Active sprints view.
fields.summary: Is there any way to add board name in the title of Backlog view (not just show "Backlog")

fields.description:
Error -> OK seems a little strange. 

Got this from [~mwatson]. This popped up for him when JIRA was down. 

Needs to explain perhaps that JIRA is currently not responding, try again later or something... 
*OR* shouldn't it redirect to a page saying that JIRA is down?
fields.summary: Error message on Rapid Board when JIRA is down needs to be more verbose
Instant search does not revert to search icon when using Clear All Filters

fields.description:
h3. Description

User would like to choose whether the issues (that weren't done in the Sprint that was closed) go to the next Future Sprint or go back to the Backlog.

h3. How it is

# Create a Board and 2 sprints
# Fill the first Sprint with a couple of tickets and start it
# Complete some issues (not all) and complete the sprint
# The issues that weren't done during the Sprint will be automatically put to the next Sprint

h3. How the user would like it to be

The user should be able to configure if he wants the following behaviour:

# Create a Board and 2 sprints
# Fill the first Sprint with a couple of tickets and start it
# Complete some issues (not all) and complete the sprint
# The issues that weren't done during the Sprint will be automatically put to the next Sprint

*Or this behaviour*:

# Create a Board and 2 sprints
# Fill the first Sprint with a couple of tickets and start it
# Complete some issues (not all) and complete the sprint
# The issues that weren't done during the Sprint will be automatically put back to the backlog
fields.summary: Completing sprints moves all issues that weren't done to the next future sprint

fields.description:
Hi there

I cannot see a board that was I created - Implementation Board - where I have been assigned Administration rights.

Can you please advise if there is a setting missing etc?

Thank you,
Karen
fields.summary: I cannot view a board created - Implementation Board

fields.description:
Hi there

I cannot see a board that was I created - Implementation Board - where I have been assigned Administration rights.

Can you please advise if there is a setting missing etc?

Thank you,
Karen
fields.summary: I cannot view a board created - Implementation Board

fields.description:
I have created two Business Equipment (Epics) but which are not displaying in the "Plan" mode. query result showing these epics.

its urgent issue to resolve, please guide me.
fields.summary: Epics are not showing up in the plan mode

fields.description:
When starting a Sprint from the Backlog, the Start Date uses the correct MM/dd/yy format, but the End Date is still using the old default format.
When we try to start the Sprint using the old format in End Date, we receive an error stating "'dd/MM/yy 12:00 AM' is not a valid date. Please enter the date in the following format: MM/dd/yy".

Error message on the screenshot attached:
"Issue XX-XX does not have a value for the 'Estimate' field. Values entered after of the sprint will be treated as scope change."

All date settings on JIRA are MM/dd/yy
fields.summary: Wrong date format for the END Sprint time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Steps:
- Go to the "create board" section, choose "Create board by existing filter"
- In the create board dialog, click on the dropdown button to show the list of filter.

Error:
- You will se that it only show you 20 first filters, and it won't load more unless you start typing. It means that you cannot see the full list of available filter you have
fields.summary: In create board dialog, the list of filter by default only show 20 iterms

fields.description:
I'm not able to use JIRA Agile after we upgraded the plugin.
Jira Agile plugin version - 6.6.80
fields.summary: I'm not able to use JIRA Agile after we upgraded the plugin.

fields.description:
At this point, any change to the Sprint Dates (like changing its end date) isn't shown on Sprint Reports like a scope change is.

It would be nice to log this activity on the Reports as well.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I would like to have changes in Sprint dates shown on Reports
Wrong date format in creating sprint (end date)

fields.description:
Hi JIRA Agile Team,

We are currently using JIRA Agile 6.6.41 version of the plugin on our JIRA server 6.2.7 version. We have started to plan our JIRA server upgrade to 6.4.x, and so also looking into upgrading Agile to 6.7.x. We understand that with Agile 6.7.x, Classic Boards are being deprecated. We have a lot of customer who will need to be migrated from Classic Boards to Rapid Boards, but we need to utilise the Parallel Sprints feature with this migration for their use cases.

We wanted to understand Atlassian's plan on releasing the "Parallel Sprints" feature which is still in Agile Labs. Please share any details with timelines, as possible.

Thanks & Regards,
Qualcomm SUpport
fields.summary: Parallel Sprint in Agile Labs - timelines on release

fields.description:
We've created a custom field for adding multiple co-assignees to a task, and added it to the card display on our kanban board. We also use the dashboard widget that shows the board. The dashboard widget shows raw HTML instead of actual co-assignees.

The attached screen shots show that the card shows the co-assignee(s) properly on the actual board, and the other shows the problem on the dashboard widget.
fields.summary: Custom field not showing properly on Kanban board dashboard widget

fields.description:
Currently when viewing a KANBAN Board the columns are titled as:

[number of issues in column] [Column Title] [Max <limit #>]

I think it would be more easily read if the columns were titled as:

[Column Title] [number of issues in column]/[column max]

I think this is more readable than what we see today.  I think even breaking between the column heading and then listing immediately below the total issues as a fraction over the max issues allowed might even be more readable.
fields.summary: KANBAN Board Column Heading Readability Enhancement

fields.description: I've noticed that the sprint report from an Agile Board is displaying incorrect story points for cloned issues.  It appears that it's displaying the original story points from the issue that was cloned.  When I select "view in issue navigator" then the correct story points are displayed.  The sprint report is wrong however.
fields.summary: Story Points have incorrect value in Sprint Report for Cloned Issues

fields.description: In the Kanban Board configuration settings, for Card Layout, it would be great to have the option to display the 'Comments' field - just the most recent comment would be great to display, even if it was truncated to just the first two or three lines.
fields.summary: Card Layout: option to display most recent comment

fields.description:
The tooltips remain active after moving the status fields
!http://cdn.spgrab.com/c8a7b6430fc6806dbc2d247ac0168380.png!
!http://cdn.spgrab.com/4f658bab0c930037d0b0b3e89b955a6a.png!
fields.summary: Agile board column status drag&drop

fields.description:
On the Agile boards, the board name is now replace with "Kanban Board" or "Active Sprints".

If I have many boards from many projects open, this makes it very difficult to see which is which. 

The name is still there - you can see it pop up as the page loads.

Can we get it back? Or at least have an option for it?
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Boards no longer display Board Names

fields.description:
As an admin, I'd like to be able to have the Epic Burndown report as a gadget in the dashboard.

Currently we have a gadget for Sprint Burndown but no gadget for the Epic burndown.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown report as a gadget in the dashboard

fields.description:
h4. +Scenario+
Using a Simplified Workflow, a Board-Project Admin can add a new status or remove an existing one if it does not contain any issues. However, it's not easy to change the Initial Status to a new one from Board Configuration. Example:
* The workflow originally contains To Do, In Progress, and Done, in which To Do is the Initial Status of every newly created issue
* A new status is added called New and the Board-Project Admin (which is not a JIRA admin) would like it to become the Initial Status instead of To Do
* He can't edit the workflow from JIRA Administration

h4. +Suggestion+
There should be an easy way for the Board-Project Admin to set a newly added status as the Initial Status, similar to marking which status has Resolution set.

h4. +Workaround+
Assume that there're now New, To Do, In Progress, and Done available, in which To Do is the Initial Status and the Board-Project Admin would like to set it to New:
# transition all issues from To Do to New
# add New to the leftmost column and move it to the top of the column
# drag To Do to Unmapped Statuses and remove it
(i) JIRA Agile prompts to replace To Do with New as the Initial Status:
!switch.png|thumbnail!
# click Remove
# to get To Do back, click Add Status and select it from the list of Existing Statuses
# drag To Do to an appropriate column

(/) New will still be the Initial Column
fields.summary: Allow Board-Project Admin to change the Initial Status of a Simplified workflow

fields.description:
JIRA Issue Macro renders incorrect data (sprint id instead of sprint name) on Confluence Page when Sprint Name column is selected.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34363
fields.summary: XML API does not export sprint name data then it makes JIRA Issue Macro in Confluence displays incorrect data

fields.description:
In a JIRA Agile Board it is possible to use the button '+ Create issue' to a quick issue creation but it's not possible to use it when you have more than one project related to the board.
Instead a message pops up saying "Due to the configuration for this particular board, you'll have to use the full dialog to create a new issue.".
Would be very helpful to have this option added for boards with more than one project.
fields.summary: Quick create issue on shared board with more than one project

fields.description: Currently, when using the Agile work board, if I assign something from one user to another, the view will automatically scroll down to the user I just assigned the issue to instead of staying where I am assigning from.  Is there any way to make this not happen, or provide a toggle or some kind of option for it to not happen?  It causes a lot of scrolling back to the user that I am assigning issues from.
fields.summary: Agile work view scrolls down to assignee automatically when assigning, instead of staying at Assignor level.

fields.description: Evidently, the Schedule permissions not only allows one to re-prioritize the backlog, but also move issues into current and future sprints.  We would like the ability to setup a permission scheme with these permissions individually controlled.
fields.summary: Separate Schedule permission
improving error message of JIRA Agile Control Chart

fields.description:
Hi there,

This issue is re-occurring and is negatively affecting our sprints.

Thank you,
Karen
fields.summary: Re-occurring issue: Fix Version on Issues is not displaying on the Development board

fields.description:
We strictly use Fibonacci story point values by the book. When the development team is working on an issue we encourage them to break it down into smaller pieces for their work and to give a more granular burn-down but without impacting the committed-to volume of the agreed whole. Presently the clone function is used for this but then further tweaking is required to adjust the story points of the clones and original issue. This causes some noise on the burndown chart and in the respective reports this looks like lots of scope change events but it isn't - it's scope neutral. Also the clones don't inherit the original's workflow state of, in our case, "commissioned".
We would very much appreciate the possibility of a "split" function, which would provide a dialog box to enter a summary for each of the new issues, inclusive of the original. It should also be possible to enter directly in that dialog the Story Points which each of the new issues, including the original, should have. This must total the same as the story points of the original. On pressing OK, the new issues would be created and the original adjusted in its summary and story point value. All issues created should automatically have the same state and assignee (as well as other meta data such as components, labels, sprint etc.) as the original did prior to the split. All of this should be registered as a single split action on the reports and be completely invisible on the burndown chart.
fields.summary: Split an issue and its story points into parts whilst maintaining state

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer has updated usernames for all users within their Cloud environment. User Management displays the new usernames. Customer then looks at Agile Boards and clicks on the owner of a board. The user receives an error that the username does not exist.

h3. Environment
Cloud 
Possibly Server 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a user with an email address for the username
Create an Agile Board with the new user
Change the username by removing the @emaildomain from the username
Go to the {{All Boards}} page and click on the username

h3. Expected Results
Correct information should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
Error is received
{noformat}
The specified user could not be found
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
It is possible to update the A0 table that holds this information.

You will need to query the A0 table that holds rapid view information: Example: AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW 
***NOTE: This may be different in a customers instance

***NOTE: Updating the AO table did not resolve this. A full lock and reindex was run after changing one of the users.
fields.summary: Agile Board owner points to incorrect username after username is changed

fields.description:
Our sprints always have lots of scope change. It's a lot easier to see this on a burn-up chart, rather than a burn-down chart.

I would like to be able to configure the Board to show a burn-up chart in the Sprint Report instead of burn-down.
fields.summary: Sprint burn up chart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA projects using Epic Links without Agile subscription enabled are unable to add Epic links to issues, add issues to Epics, or remove Epic links from current issues.

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.5-OD-07
JIRA Agile 6.7.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Project > Select Project Type > JIRA Default Schemes.
# In the new project, create an Epic.
# On the new Epic, click + under *Issues in Epic*
# Create a new issue, change type from Epic to Task.
# Save. You will notice that it has not been added to the Epic.


h3. Expected Results
* On an instance with Agile subscription, or previous to this update, you would be able to add Epic Links:
!Screen Shot 2015-06-22 at 5.15.26 PM.png!
* Additionally, from the issue view, you would be able to add an issue to an Epic right from that screen when cicking + sign.
* Lastly, you would have been able to clear the Epic Link field and remove the link.

h3. Actual Results
* View the task you created in *Steps to Reproduce*, and click *Edit*. Scroll down to *Epic Link* and you will see there's no way to add an Epic Link.

!Screen Shot 2015-06-22 at 5.15.46 PM.png!

 
h3. Notes
* See screenshots for comparison of the code when an instance is working vs. not working.
* This does work in releases prior to this release.

h3.Workaround
Start a trial of JIRA Agile
fields.summary: Users with no Agile subscription unable to add or edit Epic links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12190].
  {panel}

We have JIRA with JIRA Agile in use and upgraded to versions 6.4.5 for JIRA and 6.7.4 for Agile.
Creating a project type Kanban or Scrum raises an error sometimes (but not always).
Also selecting the created agile board gives this error.
But as said not always. On unpredictable time the error occurs.
When the error occurs it occurs for both IE and Mozilla.
I'm using IE 10.0 and Mozilla 5.0 (38.0.5).
I see simular problems with batch.js but not with these versions.
fields.summary: batch.js error

fields.description:
*Bug Description*
After closing a sprint, we noticed that the sprint velocity calculation is incorrect. The "completed issues" section shows issues that seem to have no value for the story point field. However clicking on the issue shows that there was indeed a story point value set for the issue. The problem seems to be cause by the fact that the value was added right before the issue was resolved. 

*Repro steps*
1. Create a New sprint
2. create an issue and don't add story points
3.  Add issue to the sprint
4. Open the issue, and edit the story points of the issue = 2
5. Move the issue through workflow, until completion
6. close sprint, and look at sprint story point
fields.summary: Sprint velocity doesn't account for issues with story point changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When issues are moved to a planned Sprint, and then transitioned to Done while still on the planned sprint board, the issues will not be visible.

Only when they Sprint is started will the Issues in Done status be visible again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board & project using Agile Simplified Workflow
# Configure the board to use Estimation:
## Estimation Statistic : Original Time Estimate
## Time Tracking : Remaining Estimate and Time Spent
# Add 3 issues to the board each with 10 hours Estimate & Remaining time
!sprint1.png|thumbnail!
# Open 1 or 2  issues in a new tab and transition the issue to *Done*
!sprint2.png|thumbnail!
!sprint3.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to the Board Backlog & Refresh the page. Notice that the issues that was transitioned to Done is now missing from the board.
!sprint4.png|thumbnail!
# Start the sprint now those issues that were transitioned to *Done* and which were missing earlier are now visible both in the Active Sprint Board & Backlog.
!sprint5.png|thumbnail!
!sprint6.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
Issues that are transitioned to Done on the planned sprint ( backlog ) should be visible

h3. Actual Results
Issues that are transitioned to Done on the planned sprint ( backlog ) is hidden until Sprint is started
fields.summary: Issues transitioned to Done status on planned sprint are not visible until sprint is started

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When issues are moved to a planned Sprint, and then transitioned to Done while still on the planned sprint board, the issues will not be visible.

Only when they Sprint is started will the Issues in Done status be visible again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board & project using Agile Simplified Workflow
# Configure the board to use Estimation:
## Estimation Statistic : Original Time Estimate
## Time Tracking : Remaining Estimate and Time Spent

!sprint1.png|thumbnail!
# Open 1 or 2  issues in a new tab and transition the issue to *Done*
!sprint2.png|thumbnail!

!sprint4.png|thumbnail!
# Start the sprint now those issues that were transitioned to *Done* and which were missing earlier are now visible both in the Active Sprint Board & Backlog.
!sprint5.png|thumbnail!
!sprint6.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
Issues that are transitioned to Done on the planned sprint ( backlog ) should be visible

h3. Actual Results

fields.summary: Issues transitioned to Done status on planned sprint are not visible until sprint is started

fields.description:
Can we have this feature request:
when issues created from agile board, it will default to meet the filter conditions of the board
fields.summary: Default issues created from Agile board to meet filter conditions of board

fields.description:
Using J/K to navigate cards provides them with an explicit focused style, but it isn't actually shifting focus. This means screen readers are not provided with any feedback.

Suggested fix is to apply tabindex="-1" to each card, or alternatively make each column a separate tab target with tabindex="0", and use aria-activedescendant to manage the focus of items within each column. The first option is probably the simplest and would perform more consistently across different browser/screen reader combinations.
fields.summary: Using J/K to navigate cards in JIRA Software Active Sprints/Kanban board doesn't announce to screen readers

fields.description:
As a new Agile user, I believe that it is a little bit unclear where to update the Agile license over the add-on details.

I believe that a screenshot in the documentation, exemplifying where to edit the license should reduce friction and help new users
fields.summary: Update installation documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12175].
  {panel}

Currently as mentioned in [JIRA Agile 6.3.11 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.3.11+Release+Notes] :
{quote}
If you have enabled Gravatars, they will continue to override all avatars including "first initial" avatars.
{quote}

It would be great if the "First Inital" avatar would display with Gravatars enabled. 

Hence all default Gravatar would show the "First Inital" avatar instead of the Gray default avatar. This would be easier for the user to recognized who is the assignee if the user does not upload their own avatar or use any of other Gravatars. 

Please refer to the screenshot below :

* See how the  gray gravatar is displayed for users who do not change their default avatar.
!initial1.png|thumbnail!

* Would be great if the "First Inital" avatar is  used instead but this is only available when Gravatar is disabled from the General Configuration menu.
!initial2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display First Initial avatar alongside default Gravatars on Agile Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Planning view, when filtering out issues from a specific Epic, and no issues in the Sprint currently exist for that Epic, it is not possible to move issues from the Epic into the Sprint.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Agile - 6.7.4
* JIRA 6.5*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few issues within an Epic for a Scrum Board
# Create a few issues NOT within the Epic for the Scrum Board.
# Add the issues not within the Epic to a Sprint. Leave the Epic issues in the Backlog.
# In planning mode, filter out the issues that are not in the Sprint from the Epic panel.
# You should see no issues on the top, but all listed on the bottom in the Backlog
# Attempt to drag issues from the Backlog to the Sprint. They will not go.

!Screen Shot 2015-06-18 at 11.54.10.jpg|thumbnail!

!Screen Shot 2015-06-18 at 11.54.18.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Issues should move smoothly from the Backlog to the Sprint.

h3. Actual Results
In actuality, nothing gets moved.

h3.Workaround
Do not filter the Epic issues, and move from the *All Issues* view.
fields.summary: Unable to add backlog to Sprint when filtering Epic where none exist in Sprint already

fields.description:
Hey,

in GHS-5397 showing of parent issue status was implemented for scrum boards. However, there is no way to change this status.

In our organization, we want to move the User Story, which is a parent issue to the "QA" status when all sub-tasks are also in QA status.

I don't request any automatic way to do this. I know it can be done via plugins. However, it would be nice if it was possible to change the status of the parent task directly on the board so that the person doing the transition doesn't need to open full parent task page.

Also, the fact that this information is shown, but not editable on board seems like a kind of weird discrepancy.
fields.summary: As a Scrum user I can change status of parent task directly on the board so that parent issue status can be managed more efficiently

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to sort issues within individual columns by issue id, rank, assignee, issue type, etc. Currently, all columns are sorted by the one filter query

*For example:*
I want to be able to sort issues in the *Done* column by Issue ID while other issues in other columns continue using the default order by RANK.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to sort issues within individual columns

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a configurer of an Agile board, similar to how I can configure my custom issue statuses to belong to one of the three options, I would also like to configure the columns on my agile board to be:
- {color:#205081}Not Started{color}
- {color:#f6c342}In Progress{color}
- {color:#8eb021}Done{color}

Currently the automatic assumption is that the very left column is {color:#205081}Not Started{color} and the very right column is {color:#8eb021}Done{color}.

This is a huge limitation in Jira Agile and causes problems especially with rendering the burndown chart.

I do not believe that asking the user to merge multiple of my columns into one or to create a separate Agile board is a sufficient solution for the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to add additional columns to also represent *Not Started* and *Done* in addition to the ability to already add an *In Progress* column.
 
h3. Note
Judging from the comments on GHS-10261 and GHS-11355 as well as [this post|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/218653/configuring-jira-agile-columns-for-notstarted-inprogress-and-done] on Atlassian Answers, I do feel that this is a feature of general interest.

Please stop closing every suggestion about this as "Answered" and leave any one of these three open for us to vote on.

Note: I am explicitly filing a duplicate of GHS-10261 and GHS-11355, both of which I find to have been closed prematurely.
fields.summary: In Configure Board, allow multiple "Not Started" (Grey) and "Done" (Green) columns

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We are not sure how the pop-up works after a sprint is closed. For now the pop-up shows only for the first few times and there's no way to configure that

h3. Suggested Solution
Document how the "Retrospective time!” pop-up works

h3. Answer
[How does the "Retrospective time!” pop-up works?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=757730737]
fields.summary: How does the "Retrospective time!” pop-up works?

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Retrospective time!” pop-up does not show consistently every time a sprint is closed. 

h3. How to Replicate
# Create applink between JIRA and Confluence
# Start a sprint in Agile board
# End the sprint and this triggers the "Retrospective time!” pop-up

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the "Retrospective time!” pop-up always
fields.summary: Always show "Retrospective time!” pop-up

fields.description:
When I click on the left hand issues icon from a project's kanban board, I am presented with a "newish" user interface that has two vertical scrollbars (see attached screenshots). The far right scrollbar which looks to be just a hair short of the entire page is useless, and should not be presented to the enduser.

I've attached screenshots, with ticket details blurred out, of the useless scrollbar appearing in OS X Firefox, OS X Chrome and Ubuntu Firefox. I imagine it appears in other os/browser combinations. I've also gone and put a red rectangle around the scrollbars to draw attention to the issue.
fields.summary: Two scroll bars when viewing issues in an Agile Board in the new projects sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As the Classic Boards were deprecated as of JIRA Agile 6.7, it is no longer possible to utilize the Classic Boards and configure nested versions or version hierarchy

h3. Suggested Solution
Would like the ability to create sub-versions to be used on Scrum and Kanban baords, for example:
{panel}
- Version 1
-- Version 1 Test A
-- Version 1 Test B
- Version 2
-- Version 2 Test A
etc...{panel}

h3. Workaround 
Create new versions for each sub/nested version
fields.summary: Bring Back Nested or Hierarchical Versions on Agile Boards
